016package com.exoreaction.xorcery.neo4j.client;
017
018import com.exoreaction.xorcery.builders.With;
019import com.exoreaction.xorcery.function.FallbackFunction;
020import com.exoreaction.xorcery.lang.Enums;
021import jakarta.ws.rs.NotFoundException;
022import org.neo4j.graphdb.Result;
023
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
026import java.util.concurrent.CompletionException;
027import java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage;
028import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
029import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
030import java.util.function.Function;
031import java.util.function.UnaryOperator;
032import java.util.stream.Stream;
033
034public class GraphQuery
035        implements With<GraphQuery> {
036
037    public enum Order {
038        ASCENDING,
039        DESCENDING
040    }
041
042    private String name = "default"; // Name of the query. Useful for analytics
043    private String database = "default"; // Name of the database/schema. Useful for multi tenancy cases.
044
045    private int skip = -1;
046    private int limit = -1;
047    private Map<Enum<?>, Order> sortOrder = null;
048    private Map<Enum<?>, Object> parameters = new HashMap<>();
049    private Set<Enum<?>> results = new LinkedHashSet<>();
050    private boolean distinct = false;
051    private boolean count = false; // Only do a count?
052    private int timeout = 0; // No timeout is the default
053
054    private String baseQuery;
055    private BiConsumer<GraphQuery, StringBuilder> where;
056    private Function<Enum<?>, String> fieldMapping;
057    private final Function<GraphQuery, CompletionStage<GraphResult>> applyQuery;
058    private Function<Stream<Object>, Stream<Object>> streamOperator = UnaryOperator.identity();
059
060    public GraphQuery(String baseQuery,
061                      Function<Enum<?>, String> fieldMapping,
062                      Function<GraphQuery, CompletionStage<GraphResult>> applyQuery) {
063        this.baseQuery = baseQuery;
064        this.fieldMapping = fieldMapping;
065        this.applyQuery = applyQuery;
066    }
067
068    public GraphQuery name(String name) {
069        this.name = name;
070        return this;
071    }
072
073    public GraphQuery database(String name) {
074        this.database = name;
075        return this;
076    }
077
078    public GraphQuery mappings(Function<Enum<?>, String> customFieldMappings) {
079        this.fieldMapping = new FallbackFunction<>(customFieldMappings, fieldMapping);
080        return this;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Provide a function that is invoked on {@link #build()} to create the where clauses.
085     *
086     * @param clauses
087     * @return
088     */
089    public GraphQuery where(BiConsumer<GraphQuery, StringBuilder> clauses) {
090        if (this.where == null) {
091            this.where = clauses;
092        } else {
093            this.where = this.where.andThen(clauses);
094        }
095
096        return this;
097    }
098
099
100    public GraphQuery timeout(int timeoutInSeconds) {
101        this.timeout = timeoutInSeconds;
102        return this;
103    }
104
105    public GraphQuery parameter(Enum<?> name, Object value) {
106        this.parameters.put(name, value);
107        return this;
108    }
109
110    public GraphQuery skip(int nr) {
111        skip = nr;
112        return this;
113    }
114
115    public GraphQuery limit(int nr) {
116        limit = nr;
117        return this;
118    }
119
120    public GraphQuery clearSort() {
121        this.sortOrder = null;
122        return this;
123    }
124
125    public GraphQuery sort(Enum<?> fieldName, Order order) {
126        if (this.sortOrder == null) {
127            this.sortOrder = new LinkedHashMap<>();
128        }
129        this.sortOrder.put(fieldName, order);
130
131        results.add(fieldName);
132
133        return this;
134    }
135
136    public GraphQuery results(Enum<?>... fieldNames) {
137        return results(Arrays.asList(fieldNames));
138    }
139
140    public GraphQuery results(List<Enum<?>> fieldNames) {
141        results.addAll(fieldNames);
142        return this;
143    }
144
145    @SafeVarargs
146    public final void onStream(UnaryOperator<Stream<Object>>... streamOperators) {
147        for (UnaryOperator<Stream<Object>> operator : streamOperators) {
148            this.streamOperator = operator.andThen(this.streamOperator);
149        }
150    }
151
152    public String getName() {
153        return name;
154    }
155
156    public String getDatabase() {
157        return database;
158    }
159
160    public int getTimeout() {
161        return timeout;
162    }
163
164    public Map<Enum<?>, Object> getParameters() {
165        return parameters;
166    }
167
168    public Set<Enum<?>> getResults() {
169        return this.results;
170    }
171
172    public boolean hasResultFrom(Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumType) {
173        for (Enum<?> anEnum : results) {
174            if (enumType.isInstance(anEnum)) {
175                return true;
176            }
177        }
178        return false;
179    }
180
181    public boolean hasParameterFrom(Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumType) {
182        for (Enum<?> anEnum : parameters.keySet()) {
183            if (enumType.isInstance(anEnum)) {
184                return true;
185            }
186        }
187        return false;
188    }
189
190    public int getSkip() {
191        return skip;
192    }
193
194    public int getLimit() {
195        return limit;
196    }
197
198    public <T> CompletionStage<GraphResult> execute() {
199        return applyQuery.apply(this);
200    }
201
202    public <T> CompletionStage<Stream<T>> stream(Function<RowModel, T> mapper) {
203        return applyQuery.apply(this).thenApply(gr ->
204        {
205            List<T> results = new ArrayList<>();
206
207            try {
208                try (gr) {
209                    gr.getResult().accept((Result.ResultVisitor<Exception>) row -> {
210                        results.add(mapper.apply(new RowModel(row)));
211                        return true;
212                    });
213                    return (Stream<T>) streamOperator.apply((Stream<Object>) results.stream());
214                }
215            } catch (CompletionException e) {
216                throw e;
217            } catch (Exception e) {
218                throw new CompletionException(e);
219            }
220        });
221    }
222
223    public <T> CompletionStage<T> first(Function<RowModel, T> mapper) {
224        return applyQuery.apply(this).thenCompose(gr ->
225        {
226            List<T> results = new ArrayList<>();
227
228            try {
229                try (gr) {
230                    gr.getResult().accept((Result.ResultVisitor<Exception>) row -> {
231                        results.add(mapper.apply(new RowModel(row)));
232                        return false;
233                    });
234                    return results.stream().findFirst().map(CompletableFuture::completedStage)
235                            .orElseGet(()-> CompletableFuture.failedStage(new NotFoundException()));
236                }
237            } catch (Exception e) {
238                throw new CompletionException(e);
239            }
240        });
241    }
242
243    public CompletionStage<Long> count() {
244        count = true;
245        return applyQuery.apply(this).thenApply(gr ->
246        {
247            AtomicLong counter = new AtomicLong();
248            try {
249                try (gr) {
250                    gr.getResult().accept((Result.ResultVisitor<Exception>) row -> {
251                        counter.set(row.getNumber("total").longValue());
252                        return false;
253                    });
254                    return counter.get();
255                }
256            } catch (Exception e) {
257                throw new CompletionException(e);
258            }
259        });
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Build the final Cypher query.
264     * <p>
265     * Starts with the base query string, appends whatever the optional where function wants, then creates a
266     * RETURN clause using the provided function to map fields to strings, and finally adds ORDER BY, SKIP, and LIMIT
267     * clauses if necessary.
268     *
269     * @return final Cypher query
270     */
271    public String build() {
272        // Base query
273        StringBuilder cypher = new StringBuilder(baseQuery);
274
275        // Optionally add where clauses
276        if (where != null) {
277            where.accept(this, cypher);
278        }
279
280        // Return clause
281        if (!results.isEmpty()) {
282            cypher.append(" RETURN ");
283
284            if (distinct) {
285                cypher.append("DISTINCT ");
286            }
287
288            if (count) {
289                cypher.append("count(*) as total");
290            } else {
291                cypher.append(results.stream().map(fieldMapping).reduce((s1, s2) -> s1 + "," + s2).orElse(""));
292            }
293        }
294
295        if (!count) {
296            // Sort
297            if (sortOrder != null) {
298                cypher.append(" ORDER BY ");
299
300                Iterator<Map.Entry<Enum<?>, Order>> itr = sortOrder.entrySet().iterator();
301                while (itr.hasNext()) {
302                    Map.Entry<Enum<?>, Order> entry = itr.next();
303                    cypher.append(Enums.toField(entry.getKey()));
304                    if (entry.getValue() == Order.DESCENDING) {
305                        cypher.append(" DESC ");
306                    }
307
308                    if (itr.hasNext()) {
309                        cypher.append(',');
310                    }
311                }
312            }
313
314            // Skip + Limit
315            if (skip != -1) {
316                cypher.append(" SKIP ").append(skip);
317            }
318            if (limit != -1) {
319                cypher.append(" LIMIT ").append(limit);
320            }
321        }
322
323        return cypher.toString();
324    }
325}
